page.title: 12Fairhill Trust, Alston Moor
page.content: Fairhill has been a{recreation ground for many years. Before that it was {common grazing land}used by the people of Alston for their cattle. It is now looked after by twelve{Fairhill {Trustees}who are elected, to care for it on behalf of the people of Alston. The Trustees are responsible for the repair and upkeep of Fairhill and for grass cutting. They do not charge any rent to people using the premises. Fairhill is financed out of the interest from money put into the bank from the sale of some land.
